original_title: From Individual to Family to Community: Building caring social supports for all through psychospiritual preventive interventions integrated in talk therapy
processed_title: From Individual to Family to Community: Building caring social supports for all through psychospiritual preventive interventions integrated in talk therapy
content: Author – Saira Qureshi, LMHC, Ed Psych M.A. The believers, both men and women, are guardians of one another. They encourage good and forbid evil, establish prayer and pay alms-tax, and obey Allah and His Messenger. It is they who will be shown Allah’s mercy. Surely Allah is Almighty, All-Wise. Islam as a religion with a Divinely offered way of life (shariah) values family and community strength building, immensely. Given this blessing, we can feel encouraged in offering social supports to each other as best as we can and by doing so also set healthy psychospiritual support model for future generations to benefit from. The sociological aspect of human psychological wellbeing cannot be ignored. Every family and group of people as a community or nation needs each other to rely on, during different life situations while both being able to work together as well as independently to improve personal and collective lives within familial and societal sociological structures. O humanity! Be mindful of your Lord Who created you from a single soul, and from it He created its mate, and through both He spread countless men and women. And be mindful of Allah—in Whose Name you appeal to one another—and honor family ties. Surely Allah is ever Watchful over you. As strangers to each other or close family and community members, everyone has a role and responsibility to fulfill. Nobody can always have it easy all of the time with other people, when it comes to agreeing and finding support because of individual differences in personal perceptions and limitations as to how open-heartedly one person may be able to understand and fully support another or not. Still, we can help create an atmosphere of mutual realization of first – at least, by offering a listening ear to each other and then work towards sincere cooperation while supporting each other with resources, time, and positive personal presence. Deep-seated and generationally negative lived experiences further make it harder to look for social support within one’s family and community. Al hamd Allah and Shukr Allah that there are several hadith (sayings of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and real-life examples where he (saw) expressed deep commitment to being supportive and listening to others while offering revelatory guidance and allowing healing in people who came to him being hurt, rebuked, persecuted, enslaved, scared, sad, violated, worried, and grieving. How can Muslim mental health professionals offer support to Muslim clients and all our clients from other faith backgrounds to develop positive relationships in their families and communities is through working on their own personal ways of thinking, feeling, and interacting or responding to other people with courtesy and dignity. Where relationships are really sour, we can encourage a safe and dignified manner of extending peace and goodwill, and help individuals gradually become able to find peace within and not be prone to ill-treating others, even as they may have been ill-treated. The believers are but one brotherhood, so make peace between your brothers. And be mindful of Allah so you may be shown mercy. (Hujaraat 49:10) As mental health professionals and scholars, we have a rich traditional wisdom from our faith, which we can apply in offering psychospiritual interventions to clients by encouraging them to seek helpful social supports and, when necessary, help them develop communication and emotional regulation skills along with the capabilities to forgive within reason, based on their individual life situations and the nature of dysfunctional relationships. When compassion, empathy, mercy, respect and trust are our high ideals, then we must practice and apply them in our everyday interactions with each other.  Otherwise, additional psychological problems such as antisocial behaviors, isolation, bitterness, and irritability can continue to diminish further one’s capacity to learn to trust other p...
summary: Artikel ini membahas pentingnya sistem pendukung sosial yang memperkuat hubungan antar individu, keluarga, dan komunitas dalam konteks psikologis dan spiritual. Menurut Saira Qureshi, dalam Islam, manusia sebagai makhluk yang saling bertanggung jawab, harus menjadi penjaga satu sama lain—mendukung kebaikan, melarang kejahatan, dan memperkuat ikatan keluarga dan komunitas. Islam menekankan nilai-nilai seperti kebersamaan, kepedulian, dan kepatuhan terhadap Allah dan Rasul-Nya, yang menjadi dasar bagi kestabilan psikologis dan spiritual. Dalam kerangka ini, intervensi psikospiritual yang terpadu dalam terapi percakapan dapat membangun dukungan sosial yang sehat, baik secara individu maupun kolektif. Kehidupan bermasyarakat memerlukan kerja sama antar keluarga dan komunitas, di mana setiap orang memiliki peran dalam membangun keharmonisan dan kepercayaan. Meskipun perbedaan dalam persepsi dan batasan pribadi membuat kesulitan dalam memberi dukungan, penting untuk tetap menciptakan lingkungan yang memungkinkan saling mendengarkan dan bekerja sama secara tulus. Dukungan ini tidak hanya memperkuat kehidupan pribadi, tetapi juga membentuk model pendekatan psikospiritual yang sehat untuk generasi mendatang. Dalam konteks ini, kepedulian terhadap keluarga, komunitas, dan keberkahan Allah menjadi kunci dalam membangun kehidupan yang seimbang dan bermakna. (198 kata)
